CatDescriptText: Willie Williams, cook at a downtown hotel, Palmer Avenue, Homestead and Harold Parker, driver for a carpet company, Burrows Street, Oakland, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 21, 1957, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think the city wage tax, which is one-half of one percent of your wage, is fair or unfair?" Mr. Williams answer reads: "I think it's unfair, because the Government takes so much.  For a person who has a family, there is entirely too much tax being taken out of the pay."  Mr. Parker's answer reads: "I think that its unfair because there is entirely too much tax."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Willie Williams wearing hat and eyeglasses, and Harold Parker, posed in front of brick building
